change.item: This finding aid was updated in alignment with LC EAD 2.0 specifications using a python script created by Erik Radio.

did.head: Collection Summary
did.abstract: Hurdaide was the Mexican-born captain of the presidio of San Felipe from 1598 to 1626, and was in charge of the extension of Spanish and Christian rule in Sinaloa and Sonora. He was Alcalde Mayor de Sinaloa, circa 1600 to 1626. Collection includes photocopy of transcribed typescript in Spanish with English translation

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: University of Arizona Libraries, Special Collections

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Hurdaide was the Mexican-born captain of the presidio of San Felipe from 1598 to 1626, and was in charge of the extension of Spanish and Christian rule in Sinaloa and Sonora. He was Alcalde Mayor de Sinaloa, circa 1600 to 1626.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Photocopy of transcribed typescript in Spanish with English translation.
